characters: THE SECOND CAIMAN LUNGES UP FROM THE MURKY WATER
-- SPIKES SHOOT FROM THE HANDS, EYES, AND MOUTH ON THE LI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LARA CROFT (16), a headstrong, long-haired beauty, is sur a study table by her UNIFORMED CLASSMATES, one of which, DE the group skeptic. Chyron: London, 1986

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: First of all Delia, my father is much younger than he looks. And second of all, you're completely missing the point. A LIBRARIAN across the way shushes the girls, forcing Lar her voice to a dramatic whisper:

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Once my father got inside Ghengis Khan's tomb, he thought he was home free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revealed in Lord Croft's FLASHLIGHT is Khan's decrepit MU Clutching a crudely-fashioned CEREMONIAL DRUM.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But as soon as he took the sacred drum from Khan's bony clutches... Lord Croft admires his prize stolen from the mummy.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He set off the worst trap of all. Lord Croft reacts to a RUMBLING inside the tomb. The very beneath him is buckling from some unseen force. Racing fo arched doorway, Lord Croft stops when he sees:

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: Sections of the antechamber's tile floor are falling away down into an INFINITE ABYSS now exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Croft takes a deep breath. Picks out the only route across the precarious checkerboard floor...and sprints fo entry hole, drum cradled in his arms! With each step the tile floor breaks away beneath him! Fo Croft to snatch the drum in his teeth...and leap for the with both hands!

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then, just as the wall was giving way... Lord Croft claws desperately at the crumbling wall. Eyes with rlief when a WIRE LADDER dangles into view.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My mother came to the rescue again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LADY VIVIAN CROFT, a spirited 40-something woman who expe the family chopper. Lady Vivian stares down at the mounta

dialogues.speaker: ENTRY
dialogues.text: HOLE where Lord Croft is climbing to safety on the wire l attached to the helicopter's underbelly.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There was still one problem. And it was a big one: the Mongolian Army. Lady Vivian notices DOZENS OF MONGOL SOLDIERS cresting th mountaintop. Armed to the teeth. Sights on Lord Croft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging on with one hand to the wire ladder, Lord Croft u spare hand to unload an endless UZI CLIP on the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: DELIA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don't buy it for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes are on Delia as she tries to debunk Lara's stor

dialogues.speaker: DELIA
dialogues.text: If that drum is so bloody valuable, why'd your parents send it to you? All eyes now turn back to Lara as she returns the volley:

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Easy. If you were the Mongolian Army wouldn't my dorm room be the last place you'd look? While Delia mulls that one, Lara spots a black BENTLEY AR arriving in the parking lot outside. Her eyes suddenly beam.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To be continued. I gotta go. Lara races away without explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS a floor-to-ceiling bookcase filled with odd SO from around the world, all lovingly displayed. As a woman's ha one of the souvenirs we meet LADY VIVIAN CROFT in her for elegant, real-world attire.

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Look at this, Desmond. Every little trinket we've sent back she's got on display like the Crown Jewels. LORD DESMOND CROFT is a stately business magnate but hard raider. Unlike his wife, Lord Croft is far more intereste

dialogues.speaker: OLD
dialogues.text: TRUNK across the room, overflowing with sports trophies, various academic plaques and certificates. He examines a "Ist Pla GYMNASTICS TROPHY.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: Viv, I don't think our little girl's ever come in second. Lara bolts inside, winded from her run across school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it... Lord Croft gives Lara a short, polite embrace.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought you two were off on pressing business somewhere? Lady Vivian holds onto her daughter a little longer.

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Lara, you didn't really think we'd miss your 16th birthday?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (plays dumb) Oh, is that today? Both her parents chuckle at Lara's wit.

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN
dialogues.text: We brought another souvenir to add to your very impressive collection. Lord Croft hands Lara a small, unwrapped BOX. Pulling off Lara's face scrunches quizzically: a new passport.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: Someday it'll be filled cover-to- cover, just like ours. He looks at Lady Vivian, who nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Well I think we should break it in, don't you, Desmond?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (suspicious but hopeful) What are you saying, Mother?

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: The provost has assured us you're so far ahead in your studies that your professors will actually welcome your absence for a week. So they can catch up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family trip!? Where're we going?

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: Anywhere in the world.

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN
dialogues.text: It's your choice, Lara. What a tough decision for Lara, who thoughtfully peruses exotic souvenirs her parents have sent her over the years

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Everywhere you've been...I've dreamed of going. Lara finally settles on the TIBETAN DRUM (from Lara's sto turns to her parents and smiles. Decision made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleek Gulfstream III -- emblazoned with "CROFT INDUSTRI soars through the jagged, pristine white mountaintops. Chyron: Over the Himalayas

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I want to ski Mount Annapurna. No one's ever skied there before.

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Lara, do you even know how to ski?

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's the fun of it -- I'll learn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara sits on the floor (dressed in an almost tomboyish ma back against a small sofa from where Lady Vivian enjoys b her daughter's long, lustrous hair. They're more like sisters their similar mannerisms and matching DIAMOND TENNIS BRACELETS. charmingly rattles off historical facts to impress her pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet you didn't know Mount Annapurna's actually a massif with two primary peaks. Annapurna 1, the tallest, wasn't climbed from the south -- where we're going to ski -- until 1970 by the Chris Bonnington expedition. The jet's handsomely appointed interior has the feel of a sitting room that comfortably accommodates 8-10 passenger Croft, who has to duck inside the cabin, pours himself a brandy at the wet bar.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: Anything you don't know, Lara?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (teasing) I suppose it's possible, Father. Lord Croft smirks as he takes a seat across from his wome

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Tell us about that drum I sent you back from Tibet?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: It's made from a human thigh bone. And it's part of an exorcism ritual. That's really all I know.

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I attended the ritual once. Last time we were here, while your father was concluding a deal in Nepal. This gets Lara's attention. And Lord Croft's.

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was very moving. The ceremony divests the dying person of all their ego and emotions, preparing them for the next life, unencumbered.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: I always miss the good stuff. Lord Croft swigs the last of his brandy. Lara peers out t at the enigmatic mountains while confessing:

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: You want to know something funny...? For years now I've told stories at school about my parents being famous tomb raiders -- that's how I explained why you were always away on business. (turns back to parents) My friends actually think all those souvenirs you sent me, they're all ancient treasures. Like that drum, I've almost convinced them father stole it from Ghengis Kahn's tomb. Lord Croft gets a CHUCKLE over that one. But Lady Croft i amused, seeing beneath her daughter's imagination.

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN
dialogues.text: I know it's not been easy for you, Lara, what with us abroad so often. But from now on, we'll do better than just holiday visits. How does a family trip each month sound? Lara looks to her father, who concedes his approval.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I can't wait for next month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING strikes in the darkening distance. The Gulfstre disappears into a swirling miasma of low, dark clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aircraft begins to shudder and sway in the turbulence looks anxiously to her parents as a SPEAKER in the cabin squawk one of the pilots addressing the Crofts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to worry about, folks. Just some temperamental weather. Strap yourselves in tight and we'll be through this in no time. Lara glances nervously out her misted window at the storm as LIGHTNING strikes the wing of the jet! The interior LIGHT The jet drops sudden altitude...then stabilizes. The Crof exhale in momentary relief. Lord Croft unbuckles his seatbelt and heads for the cockp

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Desmond?

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: You girls stay put. Lady Vivian clutches Lara's hand with her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWO PILOTS, struggling to hold onto the shaking contr acknowledge Lord Croft as he slips in through the partiti

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: Anything I can do?

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: There's a portable radio in the closet. Better get it out.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: (steps closer) What's wrong with those dials?

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: We've lost primary power, Sir. (beat) She's going down. His jaw slackening, Lord Croft stares out the windscreen.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: Good God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a sudden break in the clouds appear two oncoming mountaintops. An unavoidable obstacle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aircraft continues its inexorable course right betwee craggy peaks...SHEARING OFF THE ENTIRE LEFT WING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos ensues as the jet begins a slow barrel roll, emptyi overhead bins and closets. Lady Vivian cradles Lara tightly to her shielding her daughter as best she can before -- -- SMAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAASH! The jet SLAMS into the ground w force the fuselage CRACKS in several places. A piece of t fuselage strikes Lady Vivian in the head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plowing across the snowy terrain like a runaway train --

dialogues.speaker: OBLITERATING
dialogues.text: ALL TREES in its path -- the jet finally comes to precari UPSIDE DOWN, bridging a deep chasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU - LARA hanging upside down in her seat. Unconscious. CRAAAAAAAAAK!!! The already split fuselage breaks further strain of its own weight. This rouses Lara, who struggles to orient herself. Her ey in on her mother crumpled and bleeding. Lara unbuckles her s and falls to the inverted ceiling. Scrambling through the cabin Lara desperately cradles her mother.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Mother. Mother please. Please be okay. Lady Vivian's eyes flicker with dying life. Lara rambles

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. I should've picked someplace else. We never should've come here. Never, ever... Lady Vivian reaches a trembling hand up to Lara's face, g wiping away the tears streaking down her flushed cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: LADY VIVIAN
dialogues.text: Always follow your dreams, dear. (last breath) Always... Lady Vivian expires in her daughter's arms and Lara's sob way to an emotional torrent of tears until --

dialogues.speaker: -- CRAAAAAAAAAK
dialogues.text: The fuselage breaks further, threatening to snap the jet half. Jolted from her misery, Lara peers out the jet wind wide eyes:

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: It's a 1000 stomach-turning feet to the bottom of the cha

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Lara hears the sounds of a man GROANING somewhere near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara rushes into the upended cockpit where both pilots ha their seats -- the windscreen has been shattered. Lara se father's feet, his body covered with a collapsed section interior.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Father can you hear me!? Lara frantically extricates her father, who is groaning i from the COMPOUND FRACTURE of his left leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vivian...where's my Vivian? -- CRAAAAAAAAAK!!! The fuselage breaks further, increasin incline inside the doomed jet.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Come on, we've got to get you out! Lara starts helping her father up towards the windscreen. him through the jagged orifice, Lara watches her father toppl onto the snowy chasm bank. Lara starts out herself, then smart realizes:

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Supplies. We need supplies. Moving back to the closet, Lara starts gathering essentia MEDKIT, SKIS, FLARE GUN, etc.) All the while the metal fu

dialogues.speaker: WHINES
dialogues.text: under the tremendous strain...portending -- -- CRAAAAAAAAAK!!! This break causes Lara to fumble the f Hanging on, she strains to reach the weapon...

dialogues.speaker: LARA GET OUT
dialogues.text: Stretching that extra inch, Lara secures the flare gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the supplies, flung through the windscreen, land in t around Lord Croft, who's anxiously watching for... LARA DIVES THROUGH THE WINDSCREEN as the jet snaps in hal tucks & rolls safely in the snow, showing off some well-honed g moves. Together, Lara and Lord Croft watch in stunned sil the jet fuselage CRACKS once more and, with her dead mother a plummets into the chasm. Lara steps right up to the dangerous edge, tragic witness jet  EXPLODING IN A FIREBALL when it hits rock bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK a long path through the snow to Lord Croft bundled TOBOGGAN/LITTER fashioned from skis. Slowly pulling her f along in the knee deep snow, Lara is battling hypothermia and f a LIGHT SNOW falls.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (mutters repeatedly) We'll be fine... We'll be fine. Hauling her father up a slight grade, what's left of Lara strength is put to the test. As she feels herself reaching a break Lara's "We'll be fine" mantra just gets louder -- she's r pure will power now. Finally, just as she crests the grad to collapse, Lara spots a MONASTERY in the near distance bel almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're gonna make it! Her spirit refueled with hope, Lara gets a second wind. P father along with hopeful urgency...until an ANIMAL GROWL surrounding shadows stops her cold. Arming herself with a

dialogues.speaker: FLASHLIGHT,
dialogues.text: Lara scans the area:

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: The flashlight finds a BLOOD TRAIL leading from her fathe a pair of SNOW LEOPARDS lurking amongst the trees.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Lara quickly FIRES A FLARE...which spirals into the trees spooking the animals momentarily. As the leopards advance hungry eyes, Lara starts pulling her father as fast as her legs them to the monastery before... A 20' PRECIPICE suddenly appears in her path! Nearly rus blindly off the edge, Lara and Lord Croft survey their options: p behind them, a dangerous jump ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Father...I don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: Save yourself, Lara. Everything we've worked for...your mother and I. You're all we have left now. Lara eyes the snow leopards moving slowly in for the kill

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I can't leave you like this!

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT
dialogues.text: I can't make it, Lara. You can. (imploring) You must. Forced to act fast, Lara dumps all her supplies in a pile feet. With focused, unblinking eyes she rapidly examines all he resources before grabbing up two items... CU - A FLARE is snapped in half. Keeping one eye on the s leopards, Lara cleverly spreads the flash powder into a semi-circle her father. And just as the snow leopards lope into swift att -- WHOOOOCOSH! Lara ignites the powder with a LIGHTER. Th high WALL OF FIRE keeps the leopards at bay. For now.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CROFT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's my girl. Lara kneels beside her father, clutches his hand in hers.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I'll get help, Father. Before this fire dies out, I swear to you. Lord Croft watches as Lara moves away from the precipice, her steps all the way back to the fire wall. Exhaling sl gathers herself. Hands fall to her side; a gymnast before routine. Then, with quick, precision steps...Lara sprints for the leaps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara soars through the air with the grace of an eagle. Bu lands hard, somersaulting several times in the snow. Immediatel

dialogues.speaker: CRIES
dialogues.text: OUT in pain, her knee badly injured. Gritting her teeth, Lara glances back at the dwindling FL protecting her father from the leopards...then starts cra towards the wooden monastery gates ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the ancient stone building a spry monk, KARAK (50) his reverent meditation at a small shrine. His wise eyes sear candlelit shadows -- something is amiss. With uncertain p Karak moves to the nearest window where he sees: Lara inching t snow. Ten feet from the monastery gates before finally su to exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROUP OF MONKS, led by Karak, circles around to the pre froma hidden, sloping ridge. The monks BANG POTS & KETTLES, suc scaring away the snow leopards. Karak is the first to arrive at Lord Croft's side. He ben the motionless man, listens for a heartbeat. After a moment, slowly raises his head. His eyes tell the sad story as the flare quietly dies out.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: PRELAP the sound of drums, trumpets and bells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm has cleared. A Tibetan funeral ceremony in prog Croft's body is swathed in a white robe atop an altar. A handful of monks circle the dead man, performing the ex ritual Lady Vivian described earlier. REVEAL - LARA watching the ceremony from a distance, off herself. As one of the monks fervently bangs his drum -- a replica parents' souvenir -- over her father's head, Lara turns a unable to endure the tragic irony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With views of both Lara and the ceremony, Karak turns awa window, faces an older monk at his side, TONPA.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: I cannot explain it, Tonpa, but I feel my path is being re-directed.

dialogues.speaker: TONPA
dialogues.text: Your dreams.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: Yes... This girl's spirit is precious but fragile. She needs guidance to fulfill her potential.

dialogues.speaker: TONPA
dialogues.text: Go with her, Karak. And fulfill your own potential. Karak nods respectfully and heads for the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara limps along the monastery wall as the ceremony conti stops, her back to us, and stares down the sheer cliff in fog- enshrouded valley below. CIRCLING AROUND Lara we reveal h her eyes -- nearly catatonic with grief. Melancholy classical swells over the fading drums. As we PULL BACK, Lara inexplicabl dives forward... ...and splashes into an Olympic-sized indoor pool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LARA (29), collects DIVING BELLS as part of a training re supervised by Karak, now mid-60s. Chyron: Hampshire, 1998 When Lara finally breaks the surface with the last diving Karak clicks his stopwatch, eyebrows raised, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: Two seconds better than last week. But you're pushing yourself too hard again.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Still breathing, aren't I? Lara gracefully climbs from the pool, showing off a beaut sculpted physique...frustratingly wrapped in a towel. Thi longer the lonely, precocious girl we met 13 years ago; L grown into a cool, physical young woman hiding a scarred heart never fully mended. Karak follows Lara inside the sparsely decorated grand ma stopping at a STEREO setup surrounded by small mountains of CDs. K switches the somber CLASSICAL MUSIC to HIP HOP.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: You need a vacation. Change of pace. I've taken the liberty of providing a few options... He catches up to Lara, hands her some CLUB MED BROCHURES.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've already spoken with Ruth and  Caroline. They're very excited at the prospect.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (not in the mood) I don't need another girl getaway. I just get so restless between jobs. You know that, Karak. Karak steps in front of Lara, indicates her WOUNDED ARM.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: Lara, you still haven't healed from your last "job." Which was less than three months ago.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (sighs) Seems like three years.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: You want to live on the edge, how about a nice trip to Los Angeles? Lara smirks, but makes no commitment as she strides away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SALVAGE BOAT floats atop the choppy waters off the coas distant island. Chyron: Caribbean Ocean, near Barbados A gray-haired Scot, DARBY ERICKSON (70), anxiously adjust oxygen tanks on his-Venezuelan diver, ARTURO (35).

dialogues.speaker: DARBY
dialogues.text: Remember Arturo, the chest may be decayed. Go eyes open for the hardware. Darby shows a PHOTO of a wooden chest with GOLD ORNAMENTS

dialogues.speaker: DARBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The map tube will be somewhere in the vicinity, if I've calculated  right. Arturo nods, pulls on his face mask. Darby pats him on th shoulders, then watches him roll backwards off the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW Arturo down 30+ meters through the teeming waters remnants of an ancient SHIPWRECK scattered over the coral Arturo skims the rotting wreckage... A GIANT MORAY EEL lunges from a crevice flashing razor te Arturo contorts his body to avoid the attack...then continues on spots a GLINT OF GOLD entrenched in the coral. Upon close inspection it's one of the GOLD ORNAMENTS. Arturo uses a PORTABLE JETPULSE to unsettle tne ocean flo silt begins to settle, Arturo finally locates a large, se

dialogues.speaker: MAP
dialogues.text: TUBE half-submerged in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SALVAGE BOAT DAY
dialogues.text: CU - A MAP is delicately unrolled by rubber-gloved hands.

dialogues.speaker: DARBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Exquisite. Perfectly preserved. REVEAL - DARBY & ARTURO huddled inside the tiny cabin, ex centuries-old Spanish map atop a work table where the emp

dialogues.speaker: MAP
dialogues.text: TUBE now rests. The area charted is a crude representation of South and C America. Darby excitedly follows with one finger a MARKED inland from the coast to the Andes Mountains.

dialogues.speaker: DARBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There it is... El Dorado.

dialogues.speaker: ARTURO
dialogues.text: Very dangerous terrain, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: DARBY
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Arturo. This old bloke  is smart enough to know his limitations. (slowly rolls up map) I know exactly who to call.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: Lara! ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arriving amidst a cacophony of BARKING DOGS is Lara's unm maternal Aunt, EVELYN CROFT (60), a grand dame of the Lon scene who doesn't bother knocking. Evelyn saunters into t expansive living room, which is filled with state-of-the-art GYMNAS TRAINING EQUIPMENT.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Lara, where are you!?

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Coming, Aunt Ev! Lara, dressed in workout gear, is in the middle of an exe the UNEVEN BARS. Her perfect dismount is a BACKFLIP/HALF- TWIST...landing a foot in front of a startled Evelyn.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Oh good God! Don't do that.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I assume this isn't a social visit. You're not wearing your fur. Evelyn ignores Lara, focusing instead on all the equipmen

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: I will never get used to this rubbish. (melodramatic sigh) Oh, the parties your mother used to throw in here...black ties, gorgeous gowns...such a travesty. Heard it all before, Lara heads for the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you going, Lara? This isn't a social visit, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Lara makes her favorite EGG SALAD AND PICKLES sandw Evelyn nosily inspects every kitchen cabinet and cupboard.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Granted, I am no longer your legal guardian. But I am still the only real family you've got. Her back to Evelyn, Lara mouths her aunt's words in perfe sync along with her. Clearly this is not a new speech.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said nothing when you returned from Tibet with a strange monk... And I bit my tongue when you turned that living room into a gymnasium. But your continual resistance to take responsibility of the family affairs is becoming unacceptable. There is an absolute mountain of paperwork to be signed -- you know I never wanted this job. It was only out of respect for my dear brother -- Lara finally turns to interrupt her aunt's rant:

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Aunt Ev. I promise to catch up by your party next week.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Good then. That's a start. Evelyn helps herself to the other half of Lara's sandwich

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You seem awfully pallid, child. I hope this is not your regular diet. FOLLOW Lara as she rolls her eyes, walking away from it a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know! How about a nice vacation? Club Med, perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clothes and books everywhere. PHOTOS of her and friends - female -- at various events (Charity Ball, Wimbledon, etc sits in the lotus position atop her bed cluttered with Club Me brochures. She's watching "The African Queen" on TV while chatting o phone with some unseen lover.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: .В»..I'm not giving you the duck again, Charles. I'm just not in the mood for clubbing tonight. (pause; smirks) Let me remind you, I am a proper British girl. My ears are not suitable for such gutterspeak. (beat; teasing) Maybe I'll call you tomorrow. Lara hangs up. Unable to satiate her restless mind, Lara the bookshelf full of all those souvenirs from her parent travels. When Lara picks up the TIBETAN EXORCISM DRUM, we see that the tough exterior she has fashioned for herself lies the vul of a teen girl. But her reverie is broken by her BARKING GUA outside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karak watches one of many MONITORS which display constant changing images from surveillance cameras around the estate. A Lon

dialogues.speaker: TAXICAB,
dialogues.text: idling by the front gates, currently has Karak's undivide attention as Lara enters, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: We have a visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab has vanished. Lara and Karak find ARTURO lying on outside the front gate of the estate. Pulling the man's c Lara reveals his nasty ABDOMINAL WOUND.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: I'll call an ambulance. As Karak hurries away, Arturo hands Lara a Hi-8 VIDEO.

dialogues.speaker: ARTURO
dialogues.text: This...only for...Lara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lara cues up the Hi-8 video in her top-of-the-line scr room, Karak enters with dour news:

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: The paramedics removed the body. This draws an exhale of remorse from Lara.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I convinced the authorities to wait until tomorrow for your deposition.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Hopefully this'll have some answers. Lara starts the tape which plays out on a projection scre turns to a wide tripod shot of DARBY ERIKSON.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Darby... Clutching the empty, GOLD MAP TUBE, Darby paces a dimly l bungalow, speaking to the camera nervously.

dialogues.speaker: DARBY, (ON TAPE)
dialogues.text: Please forgive the melodrama, my dear, but I'm certain the phone lines here aren't safe. You've heard of El Dorado, the lost city of gold? Well, believe it or not, I actually found a map to the place. And it  is authentic. Darby points to the MAP, unfurled atop the nearby desk an illuminated by a SPECIAL INFRARED LAMP.

dialogues.speaker: DARBY, (ON TAPE)
dialogues.text: How'd I pull off this miracle, you ask? Using an 18th century weather chart I calculated a hurricane off Barbados about the same time a spanish galleon -- the San Roque -- turned up missing in 1784. (deep breath) That's the good news. Bad news is, turns out the Aussie bloke who hired me is a second cousin to the Devil himself. I told him I couldn't find the map but he didn't buy it for a minute. And it's only a matter of time before he tracks me down. Which is where you come in, my dear. Darby steps closer to the camera, desperation in his voic

dialogues.speaker: DARBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I know you're a cash up front girl, but if all the legends about El Dorado are true, I'm offering you a 50-50 split on what could be billions in gold. I should think that'll do your charity Foundation right proud. Arturo, at the far window, reacts to oncoming HEADLIGHTS.

dialogues.speaker: ARTURO
dialogues.text: Someone's coming. Darby acts quickly, returning the map to its gold tube.

dialogues.speaker: DARBY
dialogues.text: Lara, I can't do this without you. If you're game, meet me on the 7th in Curacao. I'll be at the El Mar under the name Flannigan. The sound of MEN APPROACHING cause Darby and Arturo to ur discuss evacuation plans in hushed tones. LOUD POUNDING o  brings a warning:

dialogues.speaker: OPEN UP
dialogues.text: REACTION SHOTS: Lara and Karak are on the edge of their s While Darby climbs out a side window, Arturo shoves the h

dialogues.speaker: DRESSER
dialogues.text: against the door but -- -- KABLAAAAAMBLAAAMBLAAAMBLAAM!!! The door and dresser sp a hail of SHOTGUN BLASTS. Arturo goes spinning to the floor What's left of the dresser and door are pushed aside as S hefting 12 GAUGE PUMP-ACTION SHOTGUNS enter the room. Mus bald LARSEN, the most malevolent of the Aussies, informs his u boss:

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The geezer got away... A seventh man enters last. This is CHRISTIAN MALVERN (40s formidable, lantern-jawed Australian businessman. He calm through the debris over to the OPEN SIDE WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Left his little troll behind, though. Malvern turns his attention on Arturo, who is writhing on in pain; a jagged WOOD SHARD has impaled itself deep in his Malvern looms over Arturo, cruelly stepping down on the s his boot. REACTION SHOTS: Karak looks away in disgust; Lara stares anger, clutching the TV remote like a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: Tell me where I can find Erikson. Arturo grits his teeth in agony as Malvern twists the sha

dialogues.speaker: ARTURO
dialogues.text: (hisses defiantly) El Dorado. Malvern crouches by Arturo.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: Here's why I won't kill you. Everything I do has a purpose, and whether you live or die means absolutely nothing to me. (stands) I'm not above suffering, however. In fact, I'ma big fan of it. SIRENS are heard approaching in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN
dialogues.text: Bastard must've called the cops! With his boot, Malvern pushes the shard all the way into who WAILS in pain. As Malvern strides for the door:

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: Get your men out of here, Larsen. Larsen is the last one out of the room. He finally spots camera in the corner and fires his shotgun -- KABLAM! The cuts to ominous static. Lara stops the tape, stands.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: May I offer my opinion?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I already know your opinion, Karak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karak insistently follows Lara out into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: So many of your jobs become dangerous along the way. This one, I must say, looks doomed from the very start. Taking an impassioned stand, Lara turns to face Karak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darby Erikson is one of the best cartographers in the world. If it weren't for him I never would have found the Scion or the Dagger of Xitan. Now it's my turn to help him.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: Help him evade the Australian, or help him find El Dorado?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Why both, of course.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: You travel to the ends of the earth. You risk your life at every turn. What is it you're looking for, Lara?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: When I find it, I'll let you know. As Lara heads upstairs, Karak mutters to himself:

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: Hardly the vacation I had in mind.

dialogues.speaker: UNKNOWN, (THROUGH TELESCOPE)
dialogues.text: Lara, dressed in a sun dress and combat boots, rides her Norton motorcycle and passes an engraved stone sign, "CAM UNIVERSITY." WE HEAR male voices:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Oh Christ, I don't think she's wearing a bra --

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: -- Give me that!

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Get lost, you wanker! PULL BACK to reveal we are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three engineering eggheads (STUART, LIAM & WESLEY) grapp rights to the TELESCOPE, currently controlled by Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Knock it off! She's coming in! All three young men scramble away from the window. While stashes the telescope, Liam checks his hair in a mirror a quickly gargles in the sink. There's a KNOCK at the lab door, then Lara enters smiling

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: How're my Gadget Boys doing?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Her "Gadget Boys" are now seated quietly at work stations engineering devices per Lara's faxed DESIGN SKETCHES. They AD LIB "He

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. Had to give a deposition... Lara strides over to Stuart, her attention already grabbe circular steel PROBE he's still wiring.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just as I imagined it. Stuart turns one last screw, then picks up a REMOTE CONTR which when activated...levitates the probe!

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Didn't have time to build it exactly to your specs. But I think you'll like it. With Stuart controlling the probe's micro airjets, it zip the lab...almost taking the heads off Liam and Wesley!

dialogues.speaker: STUART, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (mischievous) Oops. Sorry lads. Impressed, Lara now eyes the MONITOR on Stuart's work sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image on the monitor is a LIVE SHOT from the remote p flies through the air...finally hovering right behind Lar ZOOMING IN for a tight shot on her backside.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Very clever, Stuart.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Liam confidently gestures Lara over to his work station.

dialogues.speaker: LIAM
dialogues.text: Mine's even better, Lara. Come see. He shows off a thin, lightweight chrome AIR TANK with noz

dialogues.speaker: LIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 80 ccs of emergency oxygen, just like you wanted. But, when you hit this little button here... A SIX FOOT FLAME SHOOTS FROM THE TANK! Nearly incineratin who jumps back in shock.

dialogues.speaker: LIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoops. Stronger than I thought. Lara pats Liam playfully on the head.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Such a little firebug, aren't we? (beat) And what about you, Wesley? How did you get on with my shopping list? Wesley smiles shyly at his work station where we see a sp CUSTOM AMMO. He breath-polishes what resembles a thick SI ATTACHMENT, then screws it onto a retro-fitted GUN.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Multi-tasking compression assembly. Accommodates custom pitons, flares, harpoons and tranquilizer darts. Wesley loads one of the trang darts into the assembly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how fond you are of animals. Suddenly spinning like James Bond, Wesley levels his gun and Liam who both duck below their work stations.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiles impishly) Psyche.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Excellent job. All of you. You flatter me with your brilliance. She lays an ENVELOPE stuffed with pound notes on the tabl

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hope this covers your tuition here for another semester.

dialogues.speaker: STUART
dialogues.text: Beats the hell outta Work Study. As Lara collects her new gadgets into a leather SADDLEPAC

dialogues.speaker: LIAM
dialogues.text: So Lara, what're you gonna do with all this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Love to stay and chat, guys, but I've got to catch an early flight tomorrow. Having what she wants, Lara starts for the door...but not forlorn faces of her Boys, who can't get enough of her.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, tell you what. Soon as I get back we'll all go out fora pint. Any place you want. Deal? The boys all nod enthusiastically. And as soon as Lara ex lab, Stuart rushes back to his hiding place and grabs the tele within seconds, the three Gadget Boys are all squabbling again control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara cruises through the open estate gates on her motorcy halfway up the cobblestone driveway, Lara slows her motor all the lights are out in the grand manor! Killing the cycle engine, Lara cautiously dismounts.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Karak!? The sound of the GATES CLOSING behind her spins Lara arou Sensing she's about to be trapped, Lara runs for the gates, reach just as they close. Suddenly feeling vulnerable, Lara rushes b her cycle to arm herself...only to find her saddlebag of gadg disappeared! A GUNSHOT bursts the front tire of her motorcycle! Lara d cover behind the bike, but a bright FLASHLIGHT exposes he Instinctively, Lara sprints in the opposite direction, aw the light... A blistering volley of GUNSHOTS kick up grass and dirt al Lara, funneling her towards the elaborate HEDGEROWS which the north side of the estate. Suddenly -- -- A LARGE STATUE tips over near the hedgerow entrance! L sideways, SOMERSAULTING to safety...or so she thinks -- -- ANOTHER STATUE is nearly upon her from the other side, Lara to BACKFLIP out of the way. She steals a breath, only to Statue's face EXPLODE from gunfire! Off she goes like a b herself...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HEDGEROWS
dialogues.text: Lara creeps along the gravel pathway, lit only by small All around her in the labyrinth she can hear FOOTSTEPS of unk assassins somewhere amidst the 10' hedge walls. Lara cree quietly, her eyes unblinking while maintaining a nearly impercepti breathing rhythm -- -- SHTOOOOSH! A long wooden SPEAR juts through the hedger impaling her. Lara jumps back...only to have a second spe her path! Turning to run, Lara reacts in mid-stride to yet an spear in front of her: she dives to the ground...ROLLING HER BO lengthwise beneath six more jutting SPEARS...until she hits the end pathway. When the next spear jabs from the hedgerow, Lara is ready grasps it quickly with both hands -- surprising her unseen attac yanks the spear from him! Seeing an ASSASSIN approaching her with flashlight, Lara running start down the connecting pathway...and uses the VAULT HERSELF atop the hedgerow!

dialogues.speaker: ATOP THE BORDER WALL
dialogues.text: Leaping from the hedgerow up onto the 15' border wall, La armed with the wooden spear -- now stands atop the stone border surrounding the property's perimeter. An ASSASSIN (with a FLASHLIGHT) comes at her from one dir atop the border wall...forcing Lara to sprint the other direct another ASSASSIN up ahead on the border wall blocks her p Trapped again. As GUNSHOTS ring out Lara examines her options: It's a 15 down to the ground, where a ROSE GARDEN will make for a v painful landing. With the Assassins closing in fast from both dir what will Lara do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On one of the monitors we watch Lara snapping off a short the spear over her knee, then jumping towards a nearby POWER snagging it with the spear bit...riding the incline like safely down to her backyard! REVEAL - KARAK watching the proceedings, sipping a cup of

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: Impressive. Curiously, Karak finishes his tea and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara tries each of the rear doors. All locked. About to b the windows in with a patio chair, Lara's distracted by a

dialogues.speaker: FLASHLIGHT
dialogues.text: shone in her eyes from inside the house. Then, an ominous

dialogues.speaker: WHOOOOSHING
dialogues.text: sound overhead...

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: A LARGE SATELLITE DISH falling from the manor roof! Hurtl at Lara...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Lara dives out of the way, then watches incredulously as satellite dish -- still attached to the roof by its THICK CABLE -- right at her. Just as Lara drops to her knees, FLASHLIGHT both sides of the backyard converge on her... Unless she can get back up onto the border wall, Lara is trapped once again. But as the satellite dish swings back Lara gets an idea: Timing her jump perfectly, Lara hops onto the swinging sa dish. And as FOUR ASSASSINS close in below her, Lara uses the to expertly SCALE the side of the three story manor.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: Lara relaxes for a moment, catching her breath...then sho see still another ASSASSIN emerging from one of the attic win Avoiding the glare of his FLASHLIGHT, Lara runs to the ed roof. Decision time. She can either jump for the GUEST QU roof about 20' below her; or, she can take her chances with th advancing behind her. Taking a deep breath, Lara measures her steps back from t edge. Then, gathering herself gymnast style (as she did so many in the Himalayas), Lara runs full steam for the edge... ...but bails out at the last second! Sliding to a stop on shingles...and slipping off the edge! As Lara dangles precariously from the rickety rain gutter

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: She peers DOWN at the dangerous drop below, then UP at th ASSASSIN staring at her from the roof's edge.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (defiant) I don't have the map! And I'll die before I sell out Darby!

dialogues.speaker: ASSASSIN
dialogues.text: How very noble. The Assassin removes his black face mask...revealing KARA

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: Let me give you a hand.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As the rain gutter starts to give way, Lara quickly grabs Karak's hand for help back up onto the rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brushing herself off) I should've known this was just another one of your masochistic tests.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: High marks, I must say, until you pulled back from this last jump. Lara looks away, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your knee is fine, Lara. It's your memories that still hold you back.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (defensive) And what if I'd tried the jump? And what if I didn't make it? Karak WHISTLES with two fingers to his lips. Within secon the outdoor FLOOD LIGHTS pop on around the property, revealin AIR MAT between the main house and guest quarters painted to blend in with the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: Believe me, every precaution was taken. The gardening staff deserves a round of applause. Lara stares down in amazement as the six member GARDENING wave up at her, dressed in their black assassin jumpsuits lights have also exposed the WIRES and PULLEYS secretly rigging elaborate obstacle course: the two statues are being rais into place on guidewires; the bullet holes were all just a net wired SQUIBS.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hopefully this gave you a preview of what dangers to expect in the Inca tombs you're determined to explore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softening a little...) Could've done better if you hadn't snatched my saddlebag.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: Your gadgets are only that: gadgets. When your life is on the line, Lara, you'll have to rely on your mind and body, not some contraption built by a smitten engineering student. In no mood for lectures, Lara starts for the attic window

dialogues.speaker: KARAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This house has become nothing more than a waystation for you, Lara. I'm hoping someday you will realize your dreams here. Where it's safe. (beat) Relatively speaking. Lara finally turns back to Karak, an admission of his wis

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: What would I do without you, Karak? Karak walks up to her, looks right into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: I shudder to think. A smile warms Lara's face as she pulls Karak into a tight bringing a smile to his face as well -- clearly this man these infrequent moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LEAR JET touches down and taxis to a stop on the runway the pilot seat sporting her signature MIRROR SHADES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara enters the modest, nautical themed lobby. Behind the desk is the quaint Marina. Lara moves to the front desk inquir "Mr. Flannigan." Given instructions, Lara heads upstairs REVEAL - A BELLBOY overhearing this conversation. Walking the lobby, he picks up a phone and dials a number he has scri on scrap paper.

dialogues.speaker: BELLBOY
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Malvern. You asked me to call and, well... Flannigan's got a lady friend. (beat) I'll let you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara reaches Darby's room and finds a "Do Not Disturb" si on the doorknob. She knocks gently.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Darby, it's Lara. No response. But she can hear the TELEVISION on inside. L the door and finds it surprisingly unlocked. Checking bot first, Lara draws a GUN and pushes the door open. No ambush wait she slips inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are out but the TV is on, tuned into a Spanish episode of "MacGuyver." Lara flicks the light switch, turning on a DESK LAMP near The room has been completely ransacked. But that is not what Lara's breath away... REVEAL - DARBY sitting up on his bed, shot at close range Frightened eyes wide open, staring off into the void. After a moment to digest this nasty sight, Lara takes a s edge of the bed. She grasps Darby's hand, feeling his bod temperature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Darby. I'll see this one through for you. Lara tenderly closes the man's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say hello to my parents for me. Rising, Lara begins poking around the remains of the room books, charts...but nothing that resembles the map of El During her search Lara hears a HISSING sound. Quickly scanning the room, she notices something unsettli CU - A PLASTIQUE CKARGE attached to the same electrical s lamp is plugged into -- the fuse apparently activated whe turned on the light! A fuse seconds from detonation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABOOOOOOOM! As a car blows up on "MacGuyver," Lara sprin the TV to the balcony overlooking the marina and leaps... ...jJust as Darby's hotel room EXPLODES!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara just clears some docking and splashes down in the ma she bobs back up to the surface behind a boat, a crowd of is already forming outside the hotel. Including the Bell Boy watches briefly from a balcony off the main lobby, then disappear inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in a new change of clothes at a payphone on the watches from a distance as local POLICE and FIREMEN sift the remains of the blown-out hotel room.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: The authorities have so far only recovered CHARRED BONES loaded into a CORONER'S TRUCK in plastic bags.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: Croft Residence.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Turning away from the ugliness, Lara reacts to Karak's vo other end with a relieved sigh.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Well Karak, I hate to say you told me so but...I didn't want you to worry when you saw the news about the explosion at the El Mar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karak is seated in the dark room watching CNN on the big Utilizing PICTURE-IN-PICTURE mode he's also simultaneousl four other local and international news services via sate Karak quickli mutes the TV.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK
dialogues.text: (feigns indignation) I never watch television. Lara rolls her eyes knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Right... Anyway, whoever murdered Darby and took his map probably thinks they killed two birds with one stone. But it's going to take the authorities down here a while to sort out the mess. Which buys me some time to catch up with the bastards. Lara reacts to the WARNING WHISTLE from a nearby FERRY BO

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gotta go. I'm taking a ferry to the  mainland. I'll ring you later.

dialogues.speaker: KARAK, (PHONE)
dialogues.text: May I offer my opinion?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Go ahead. I'm listening. But Lara lets the payphone receiver dangle off the hook. up her BACKPACK, Lara rushes to catch her ferry. HOLD ON the receiver as we hear Karak expressing his pate of view.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A BELL BOEING 609 PROP PLANE descending vertically from t like a helicopter. The roar of its twin tilt-rotors kicking up a

dialogues.speaker: DUST
dialogues.text: STORM. We are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small village situated in the tropical low jungle of th Basin and surrounded by a dense forest of cedar, rubber a cinchona trees. Like San Francisco during the gold rush, this is a dangerous desperation; the scant populace waiting for the opportunity to scam a naive explorer in search of the fab city, El Dorado. Chyron: Francisco de Orellana, Peru Malvern's well-armed battalion of six Aussies exits the B Last one off is Malvern himself, now dressed for safari. Darby's GOLD MAP TUBE like a weapon. Malvern surveys the one street town of SUPPLY SHOPS and C all the locals are staring at his expedition with cautiou hopeful eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: (to Larsen) Buy up all the supplies in town. If we don't need it, burn it.  Larsen flicks his GOLD LIGHTER with a flourish.

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN
dialogues.text: With pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: UNKNOWN
dialogues.text: Looking through a dirty window someone watches Larsen lig Malvern's cigarette as his goons blanket the town. We hear a RADIO of a San Francisco Giants baseball game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dilapidated, Spanish-style stucco shanty with a ramshac Peeling painted letters across the window announce: "JUNG Boat or Plane, Good English, Cash Only."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet NATHANIEL DODGE (39), a rugged, world-weary American patriot working out of his cubby hole office on the main street. back in his chair, feet on the cargo crate he calls a desk, Do sharpens a MACHETE while he watches Malvern approaching. When the broadcast gives way to static, Dodge bangs his old HAMM R the knife.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: (sotto; re: Malvern) Here comes a new radio. The radio reception goes all to hell when Malvern pushes rickety screen door and just stands there, amusedly absor Dodge's spartan existence.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: Well mate, since you're the only guide who speaks English, I'd say it's your lucky day. (beat; extends hand) Christian Malvern. Dodge leans forward, shakes Malvern's powerful, weathere

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Nate Dodge. How lucky we talking?

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: Locals say the winds up near Lake Guaranita this time of year could snap the rotors off my birdie.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Wouldn't know. Never been crazy enough to take one up there. Malvern pulls out a wad of CASH and tosses it in Dodge's

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: Ten grand sound crazy enough? Dodge can't resist holding the money, fanning through the stack of US dollars.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Damn... Hate to ask how much you paid for your map?

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: (scrutinizing) And what map might that be?

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Anybody who comes here with their own militia, they've definitely got a map to El Dorado. Malvern smiles: a deadly sign for him.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: (re: gold map tube) Believe me, Mr. Dodge, this map came real cheap: cost of a bullet.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: So that's the going price now, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: I can assure you there's one difference between me and every other crackpot who's waltzed into  this bunghole town: I don't waste my time on anything less than a sure thing. Dodge keeps playing with the money, weighing his options.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: It's tempting, I gotta say. But it's the sure things that always turn out the bloodiest. Tiring of Dodge's reticence, Malvern checks his watch:

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: Either take my money or quit fondling it. I don't make offers twice. Dodge hesitates, then flips the cash back to Malvern.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Think I'll quit while I'm still alive. Malvern coldly eyes Dodge for a moment, then turns to lea

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: If you call this living...

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Close the screen, would you? (beat) Keeps the bugs out. After Malvern ignores him, Dodge lolls his head back, alr second guessing himself. Hearing the radio static, he whacks the with a pinch more vinegar; this time the reception clears audible again. Dodge smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat up TRANSIT BUS plods along a muddy dirt road which through intermittent jungle. A changeable sign across the the bus reads: "IQUITOS to FRANCISCO DE ORELLANA"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Lara sitting in a lotus position at the back of the filled bus, working intently on her customized LAPTOP, biting he girlish concentration. She has just finished uploading Da video onto her hard drive. CU - LAPTOP: The digitized video plays with stutter frami

dialogues.speaker: DARBY, (ON TAPE)
dialogues.text: Please forgive the melodrama, my dear, but I'm certain the phone lines here aren't safe. You've heard of El Dorado, the lost city of gold? Well, believe it or not, I actually found a map to the place. And it is authentic. The video camera PANS as Darby indicates the map, unfurle desk and illuminated by a SPECIAL INFRARED LAMP.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Lara FREEZE FRAMES the video and employs a sophisticated ENHANCE feature which actually brings the distant, blurry up- front focus. Lara smiles victoriously.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Ah-ha. Lara hears TITTERING and looks up to see all the LOCAL KI bus turned around in the seats. staring at her with fascinate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stopped bus pulls away...revealing Lara standing in t of the one street town, BACKPACK at her feet. FOLLOW LARA as she throws her bag over one shoulder and w towards a SMOKE PLUME curiously snaking into the air. Allong the street are "Cerrado" signs in every shop window. The town feels strangely deserted, except for the Cantina handful of LOCALS suck on cervezas -- as Lara passes, na conversations stop, all eyes fixed on her. TEMO (25), a shifty-eyed local, is the first to his feet a beeline for Lara, flashing his cherubim smile.

dialogues.speaker: TEMO
dialogues.text: Senorita need guide? Lara keeps walking, projecting disinterest very well.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I was told in Iquitos you'd have everything I need to go up river.

dialogues.speaker: TEMO
dialogues.text: You two hours late. Everyone here buyed out. But if you hire Temo as guide, I get you supplies. Lara finally stops, turns around and faces Temo.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Very persistent, aren't you, Temo. How much? Temo sizes Lara up. Very much likes what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: TEMO
dialogues.text: For you...? Only five hundred. American. Temo carry everything. Temo graciously takes the backpack from Lara.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Save you money! REVEAL - DODGE, beer in hand, leaning against the Cantina wearing a knowing smirk.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Probably save your life, too.

dialogues.speaker: TEMO
dialogues.text: Don't listen to Dodge. He's only jealous cause I here first. Dodge sips his beer, sauntering towards Lara and Temo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as scams go around here, Temo's got a pretty decent one. Once you get up river he'll sell you to the banditos for fair market value. Then trade your lingerie for a one nighter in Iquitos. Lara looks at Temo, who shakes his head adamantly.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: How very entrepreneurial. (to Dodge) But what's to say you're not part of the scam as well? Dodge finally reaches Lara and Temo, enjoying the last sw beer before he responds.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Because I didn't swipe your bracelet. Lara suddenly realizes her DIAMOND TENNIS BRACELET is gon drops the backpack and takes off... Acting quickly, Lara scoops up her backpack, takes a coup after Temo...then spins and hurls the bag like a discus t Hitting Temo in the legs, tripping him up. Before Temo can scramble back to his feet, Lara stomps on hiking boots down on his back, pinning him under.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Don't make me search you. I haven't had my Rabies shot. Fumbling a hand through his pocket, Temo holds up the bra Lara kicks his hand, sending the bracelet into the air, where catches it with ease.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright Temo, game's over. Temo picks himself up, dusts himself off. But before he l curses and spits in the general direction of Dodge, who' good chuckle out of this incident.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what's your angle, Dodge? Dodge meanders over to Lara, clearly intrigued by her.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Twinge of conscience. It'll pass.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Truth is I've seen a lot of crazy people come through here. But I've never seen anybody burn all the supplies in town just to throw off followers. He indicates with a head gesture the SMOLDERING REMNANTS bonfire in the dirt clearing near them.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm guessing you're chasing his map.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Got my own copy actually.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: You seem to handle yourself pretty well, but a lot of people head up into those mountains looking for El Dorado. Most of them never come back. Undeterred, Lara re-hefts her backpack and walks towards вЂњJUNGLE GUIDE..." office right across the main street.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I take it this is your fine establishment? She glances back to Dodge.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: The "Good English" give me away?  Lara opens the screen door, but stops before entering.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Enough foreplay. What to do you say we get down to business?

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: What makes you think I want the job?

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Where there's a twinge, there's still hope. Lara disappears inside, leaving Dodge to ponder his next an uncertain smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL VIEW of this slow-moving river which serpentines t dense Peruvian vegetation. FIND a weathered TRAWLER BOAT along upstream through a light FOG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara, clad in a wind-breaker to keep the mid-morning mist explores the narrow deck, taking in the row of sun-bleach

dialogues.speaker: ALLIGATOR
dialogues.text: JAWS nailed to the exterior cabin wall.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Not exactly the Love Boat, is it? Dodge, steering the trawler from inside his small cabin, eyes off the river ahead for only a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Black Caimans. Largest gators in the world. Just one of the many obstacles between you and El Dorado. (calls out in Spanish) Watch this bend for silt piles! DODGE'S BOATMEN (Carlos, Luiz and Paolo) are bent over th railing, working 20' long poles. Probing the river and sh ahead. Carlos gestures to "stay right."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara wanders into the cramped quarters decorated with str

dialogues.speaker: CURIOS
dialogues.text: and faded POLAROIDS from Dodge's numerous jungle tours.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Made this trip a few times, have you?

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: This river may be the safest way into Ecuador, but the Napo is no easy woman. You've got to take her slow, be real gentle. Or she'll grind you up and spit you out.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Aren't you the romantic.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Forget romance. You gotta be a realist down here. The search for El Dorado is a fool's errand. 400 years and millions of dollars have produced nothing but an impressive list of fatalities.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I've read all the stories. But just because no one's found El Dorado, doesn't mean it's not out there.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Let me tell you a story you probably don't know. About ten years ago this National Geographic cover boy came down here with a sure-fire map and six-figure trust fund. Predicted he'd find El Dorado in a week...

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (finishes his story) ...three years later he'd lost his money and his reputation. This draws a surprised look from Dodge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember reading about this poor chap when I was at Cambridge. He looked much different then. Quite dashing, actually. Always wondered what happened to him. Both of them know exactly who they're talking about. With begrudging smile, Dodge turns his eyes back to the river.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what happened. He wised up. Finally figured out he was better off selling the dream than buying into it. All three Boatmen start shouting urgently, but only Carlo speak English.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: Whirlpool! Whirlpool! Dodge quickly kills the trawler's motor and warns Lara:

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Better grab onto something sturdy! As Lara locks an arm around a cabin support pole, the boa to drift sideways, caught in the strong cross-currents respo the WHIRLPOOL looming ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Can I help?

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Don't move. Lara rolls her eyes as Dodge hurries from the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the trawler spins helplessly around, held in the relen spiral of the whirlpool's vortex, Dodge moves to the front of th yelling instructions at his Boatmen.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Keep us off the shores! Following his orders, the boatmen work frantically to pus trawler to safety. But Paolo's POLE is suddenly wrenched from his the vicious undertow...throwing the boatman off-balance and o Carlos and Luiz start shouting. Dodge rushes to join Carlos and Luiz at the railing, wher stare into the swirling water until...Paolo resurfaces ga air!

dialogues.speaker: DODGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The poles! Give him something to grab! Carlos and Luiz extend their long poles towards Paolo, wh feebly for them, too distracted by: A PAIR OF BLACK CAIMAN ALLIGATORS! Sensing easy prey. But the first gator is about to reach Paolo... Dodge whips out a serrated BOWIE KNIFE and expertly throw blade ...Skewering the Caiman in the head, killing it instantly But Paolo is not out of trouble yet. He loses his grip on pole as the trawler keeps spinning in the whirlpool. And the s gator is closing in...

dialogues.speaker: DODGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Other side! To compensate for the continual spinning, Dodge leads the Boatmen over to the other side of the trawler where: LARA is already hanging bravely over the edge of the deck clamped onto the railing.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Take my hand! A floundering Paolo reaches up and grabs onto Lara's hand Dodge and the two boatmen help pull them both to safety until.

dialogues.speaker: THE SECOND CAIMAN LUNGES UP FROM THE MURKY WATER
dialogues.text: Massive jaws chomp down on Paolo's forearm! Lara and the three men topple backwards onto the deck as awful SCREAMS gurgle away under water. Sitting on her butt, Lar realizes she is still holding Paolo's SEVERED HAND! Disgu shakes the limb loose. Carlos and Luiz move back to the railing, staring despond at the calming waters where the Caiman feeds on Paolo. Dodge picks up the hand and tosses it into the river.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: (to gator) Might as well have the rest of it! (beat; to Lara) Add another name to the list. Off Lara's concerned face, we;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At 6,000 feet overlooking the lush valley below is an ina volcano basin, half-filled with water. A singular WEDGE cut into section of the rim is testament to some explorer's long ago attem drain this mysterious lake. The water's surface begins to RIPPLE. The portentous soun ENGINES spoils the tranquility as Malvern's Bell-Boeing r unevenly above the basin rim.

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: These winds up here are nasty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed with the seven Aussies and their equipment. As Lar struggles to keep the plane steady, Malvern, in the passenger seat down transfixed at Lake Guaranita.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: Somewhere under that water is a secret worth billions.

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN
dialogues.text: Gonna have to park this birdie down below, or we're going for a dip in that water right quick. Malvern finally acknowledges Larsen with a dismissive "Do have to" gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dodge's trawler chugs to a stop at the mouth of small but rapids. From inside the cabin Dodge yells to Boatmen:

dialogues.speaker: DODGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Drop anchor and rig the ramp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in her now-familiar lotus position under a tatter at the back of the trawler, Lara works on her laptop, examin digitally enhanced image of Darby's map. CU - LAPTOP: Upon closer inspection of the map we see the DORADO" marked by a GOLDEN SUN symbol directly over an un of water. One of the sun's rays extends curiously into the l a SECRET DOOR has been drawn.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Malvern said he killed for that map... Lara finds Dodge sneaking a peek over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was expecting something more original.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man he murdered was a dear friend. Don't insult his memory by suggesting this map is useless.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Apologies to your friend, but Lake Guaranita's not hiding anything. You and Malvern are both wasting your time.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Maybe Malvern, not me. Since this map was made in 1523, magnetic north has moved four degrees, give or take. That puts this lake on the map approximately 90 meters north of Lake Guaranita. That's where I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Clever. One problem, though: there isn't so much as a mud puddle in that direction for 200 miles.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (re: map) The lake is gone. A volcanic earthquake in 1814 drained the entire bas in. Meaning this underwater door to El Dorado is actually on dry land. Lara shuts down her laptop, loads it into her backpack.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: (shakes head, amused I've heard a lot of wild theories. That one takes the cake. Lara will not be daunted.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Admit it, Dodge. All this talk about El Dorado is getting you excited again. You're thinking, "Maybe this could be the one -- "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts; defensive) -- The deal was I'd take you up river. That doesn't mean I have to watch Malvern and his goons gun you down. I do tours, not funerals.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I've had more fun at funerals. Lara hefts her backpack and strides for the ramp. Dodge f her, starting to feel guilty already.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: Look...I'd only slow you down. Take Luiz and Carlos with you. They know the jungle better than me anyway.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Another twinge of conscience?

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: (in Spanish; to Carlos) Go with the lady. First sign of trouble, bring her back here.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish; to Carlos) Ignore him. Come with me only if you'd like to make some real money. Carlos looks at Dodge, then nods to Lara. He and Luiz arm themselves with MACHETES. They follow Lara down the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: DODGE
dialogues.text: (to Lara) I'll wait here until I hear gunshots, or until you make it back. Whichever comes first. Otherwise it's about a day's walk back to the village. Lara looks over her shoulder at Dodge for a parting salvo

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I can't figure if you're more worried about my safety...or the fact that I just might find El Dorado. And put you out of business. Not willing to answer that question, Dodge watches Lara c set off into the jungle with Carlos and Luiz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blazing sun above beats down on the rugged, semi-trop terrain. Wild birds squawk incessantly throughout the canyon. PICK UP Lara following along a path cut by the machetes o and Luiz. Wiping the sweat from her face, Lara removes her wi breaker, stripping down to a tight halter top; a detail that doesn unnoticed by Carlos and Luiz. Suddenly, the sound of distant UZI FIRE shatters the rela of the jungle. Lara and the Boatmen duck in the brush.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Wait here. Lara pulls out her DUAL PISTOLS. FOLLOW Lara as she trave narrow path through the trees, until she comes upon:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cluster of TENTS form a semi-circle around the Bell-Boe parked in a small clearing. Two of Malvern's men are laug as they return to the camp with UZIS and a bullet-ridden PEC pig) tied to a rope.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BRUSH
dialogues.text: Lara gestures for Carlos and Luiz to join her; they both considerably more nervous than her as she threads the com assembly into her pistols and loads them with TRANQ DARTS

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Not very sporting, hunting with uzis. Somebody needs a lesson in nature appreciation. Lara boldly walks into the camp, surprising the Aussies, the peccary and reach for their guns. But Lara carefully take fisted aim on both Aussies, then fires her pistols simultaneousl -- SHTUT! SHTUT! The darts pierce each Aussie's neck, cru them instantly to the ground. FOLLOW Lara as she waves Carlos into the Base Camp.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Carlos and Luiz) Look for juice, chocolate. Anything sweet. Carlos and Luiz have no idea why, but they obey.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BELL-BOEING
dialogues.text: Lara unlatches the engine hatch. She removes the INTERRUP and shoves it into her backpack. Carlos emerges from a nearby a plastic bottle of HONEY.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excellent. Lara opens the bottle of honey, walks over to the unconsc Aussies and starts dousing them in the sticky, sweet stuff... Car Luiz are utterly confounded.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By the time they wake up, they'll be covered in fire ants. (smirks) Like to see them shoot their way out of that one. Carlos translates for Luiz, and they both smile too, envi the  unpleasant outcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further up the trail, Lara follows Carlos and Luiz, both hacking away with their machetes. But something catches Lara's ey of recently dug earth in a pattern. Lara gets down on her knees and carefully pushes the dirt revealing an AP LAND MINE.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Stop guys! Now! Carlos stops, looks back. But Luiz keeps walking, choppin until

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aussies, completing the set-up of an elaborate DIVING on the lake, are alerted by the distant explosion.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: One of the mines. Larsen, applying sunblock, grabs a pair of BINOCULARS.

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN, (THROUGH BINOCULARS)
dialogues.text: We scan the jungle path near the base camp, settling on t remains of a PECCARY.

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just a peccary.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN
dialogues.text: Bloody pig. But Malvern does not appear entirely convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have Base Camp check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara watches, waits for the GLINT of Larsen's binoculars to disappear before she steps from the underbrush. Lara stan the bullet-riddled peccary from Malvern's camp (laid cleverly exploded mine.)

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Let's hope that fooled them. Lara moves to Luiz's dead body where Carlos is already kn beside his dead friend in prayer.

dialogues.speaker: LARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were close with him? Carlos looks up, holding back his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: My cousin. Lara kneels down beside Carlos, lays a sympathetic hand o shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry, Carlos. If you want to go back, I understand. But I must keep going.

dialogues.speaker: CARLOS
dialogues.text: (stands, determined) No. I will go with you. For Luiz. Lara nods and hands him one of her pistols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malvern stands atop the lake rim taking out his impatienc cigarette. He's staring down at the fully assembled DIVIN floating off the near shore. Larsen, white sun-block smeared on his nose, is seated n fold-out chair reading an issue of "Cosmopolitan." The he the cover: "Show, Don't Tell."

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN
dialogues.text: (to Malvern) Did you know that 63' of women are multi-orgasmic? It's just not fair. A diver breaks the surface and confers with a second dive platform. The second diver gives Malvern a "thumbs down" prompting Malvern to angrily snuff out his cigarette butt

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: Larsen, what the hell kind of people did you hire? The divers are incompetent, Base Camp is suddenly incommunicado, and you're reading a goddamn magazine! In a flash of his temper, Malvern kicks the magazine from hands. Larsen picks up his walkie-talkie and barks a warn

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN
dialogues.text: (into walkie) Listen up you dickheads, don't make me come down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larsen's droping threats finally revive one of the Aussie tranquilized slumber... It takes him a moment to realize covered from head to toe in FIRE ANTS; he turns his head to see t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is laid out next to him in the same predicament. As the s bites register with his central nervous system:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larsen holds the walkie away from his ear as the SCREAMS Aussies nearly burst his eardrum.

dialogues.speaker: LARSEN
dialogues.text: What the hell...!?

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN
dialogues.text: Peccary my ass. While Larsen keep barking threats into the walkie, Malver the BINOCULARS and starts scanning the surrounding valley from Base Camp northward.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've got company.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN, (THROUGH BINOCULARS)
dialogues.text: In the adjacent, enclosed basin below, Lara uses a hand-h

dialogues.speaker: SCANNING
dialogues.text: DEVICE while Carlos watches her back, pistol drawn.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Two of them. Girl's got what looks like a spectrometer...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Malvern slowly lowers the binoculars, having an epiphany.

dialogues.speaker: MALVERN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's looking for volcanic gasses... another entrance. (to Larsen; urgent) Get two men back to Base Camp. The other two are coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lara's SPECTROMETER registers high levels of sulfuric aci narrow fissure.

dialogues.speaker: LARA
dialogues.text: Ah-ha.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: COMPLETE DARKNESS. Then...a rustle. A snap -- whoosh! A b controlled chemical flame. A FLARE casts light on Lara an who proceed cautiously. We are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
